Today‚Äôs @MENnewsdesk inaccurately suggests that the Government is winding up its support for rough sleepers helped off the streets during the coronavirus pandemic. This is simply wrong. Read the facts here üëá
https://t.co/vMyYVJmpQ1 https://t.co/EUJpvJDMSw

The suggestion the Government is reneging on this commitment is entirely wrong. 

Councils must continue to provide safe accommodation for those that need it - the suggestion funding is being withdrawn or people asked to leave hotels is unfounded. https://t.co/Zq0MCMZr53

While councils continue to provide accommodation to those that need it, it is only responsible that we work with partners to ensure rough sleepers can move into long-term, safe accommodation once the immediate crisis is over.
The latest figures show over 90% of rough sleepers known to councils at the beginning of this crisis have now been made offers of safe accommodation.
We have been clear councils must continue to provide safe accommodation for those that need it, and any suggestion that funding is being withdrawn or people asked to leave hotels is unfounded.
Any suggestion that the Government is reneging on the commitment set out at the start of this national emergency is entirely wrong.
Please see our response to an inaccurate article from @MENNewsdesk and @JenWilliamsMEN suggesting that Government is removing emergency support for rough sleepers ‚¨áÔ∏è
